item.title: Sebastian Linde's Site
item.description: The highly flexible website framework for Hugo with an extensible plugin mechanism. Create a beautifully simple site in under 10 minutes ðŸš€ Latest release Star

Biography Sebastian Linde is an assistant professor of economics at the department of economics at Grand Valley State University. His research is focused on the health care industry, and his interests include network formation, bargaining and pricing, mergers and acquisitions, and hospital cost efficiency.

item.title: Research
item.description: Working Papers The Effect of Bargaining Power Determinants on Pharmaceutical Prices (With Brandon Norton and Ralph Siebert) [Paper Link] Hospital Efficiency: a Factor Model Approach. Major Complexity Index and College Skill Production. (with Xiaoxiao Li and Hajime Shimao) [GitHub: Complexity Index Package] Do Mergers Among Multimarket Firms Create Value? (with Ralph Siebert), [CESifo Working Paper No. 6139] Work In Progress Exploring the Heterogenous Effects of State Price Transparency Laws on Hospital Prices and Price Distributions.

item.title: Teaching
item.description: Grand Valley State University: Graduate Classes ECO641: Business Economics and Strategy (Winter 2019) ECO643 & PA633: Health Economics (Winter 2018; Fall 2018; Winter 2020) Undergraduate Classes ECO312: Applied Microeconomics (Fall 2017; Fall 2018; Winter 2020) ECO343: Health Economics (Winter 2018; Fall 2019) Purdue University: Head Instructor ECON 451 Game Theory (Summer 2015) Award: Distinguished Instructor Award Overall Instructor Rating Score: 4.9 / 5.0 ECON 451 Game Theory (Summer 2014)
